summary: MarshallingRule class is marked as internal, preventing users from implementing custom marshalling types using RuleFactoryInterface. Static analyzers flag this as an internal API access violation.
userImpact: Users cannot create custom marshalling types without triggering static analyzer warnings about accessing internal APIs.
rootCause: MarshallingRule is marked as internal but is necessary for implementing RuleFactoryInterface, creating an API design conflict.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by PR #653, which presumably exposed MarshallingRule as a public API.
keyQuote: MarshallingRule is marked as internal, which does not allow using the RuleFactoryInterface when the corresponding rules of static analyzers are working
